TopicTitle: What voice do you read in?

Articles.Content:
As in, what voice do you have in your head when reading on the forums?

Me? Depends on the nature of the post. If it's got a lot of spelling/grammar errors (I skim it before actually reading it) I read it with a voice kinda like Borat (from the movie "Borat"), if it's scientific I read it like Jim Parsons (I'm a Big Bang Theory fan) explains/talks about something scientific (i.e. kinda fast without stopping to breathe). If it's just a joking post, I read it in a Texas accent. Otherwise, I read it like usual.

What about you?

depends on the maturity of the user and how knowledgeable they are. this can range anywhere from lemmy from motorhead to my 5 year old neice. people who are obviously russian i imagine the voice from the russian cosmonaut from armageddon. if i think you are canadian, i add random ehs.

Edited February 19, 2014 by Nuke

Morgan Freeman controls my mind.

Well, it kinda depends on the poster. Everybody has a pitch-less and tone-less voice in my head, but they're all diferent. Nice question.

no 'audible' voice. Well, now that I thought about it like that, I suppose I use my own speech pre-processor thing so it 'sounds' like how things sound when I'm just about to say them myself. Eh, dunno. All the same though! No difference between users/style
I read in Samuel L. Jackson speak. Yes, I doo add in the occasional [insert Samuel L. Jackson's favourite word here].

I also read in a version of my own voice, which varies from high to low pitch depending on my subconscious impression of the poster.

If I've heard them in a youtube video, or something, then my brain reads the words in the voice I remember hearing.

It's usually my own voice as I hear it through my skull. Sometimes it's some news reporter's.

It's never been his voice, though.
hum. I would say my own voice. though if I read it and it sound like some characters I do it in there voice

It varies, if someone's posts makes them look like a jerk all the time, i sometimes read it quicker and at a higher "Tone". Although i never purposely do this.

If i know the person's personality well enough, my brain seems to randomly associate a voice with that poster. Each person is slightly different.

Anyone who i haven't figured out yet, reads as a monotone voice of my own.

This is quite an interesting topic now that you've brought it up, i never really had though about how i read until now.

hum. I would say my own voice. though if I read it and it sound like some characters I do it in there voice

I just had to. You're repeating the same mistakes on other posts, too.
I'm tri-lingual, so my inner voice is really messed up
Various Irish accents. (The stupidest posts get read in a Cork accent)
I read in my voice, and I usually "spell" the words in my head in Hungarian... So if I had to say it loud, it wouldn't resemble English... lol
Either Jeremy Clarkson from Top Gear or Morgan Freeman.
